Let me tell ya.. if it weren't for the people around me, I could have eaten 24 wings by myself and the a few slices of pizza.  But damn.. i had to share.  I had one slice of the delicious meat lovers pizza and about 6 wings.  It reminded me of the first time I've ever eaten a good slice of pizza and wings.    We went last night for their $5 large cheese pizza night (Wed) and being new to this place, I had no idea why it was so packed (duh), til I saw the special.  We waited for about 10min and were seated.  Jessica was our server and took awesome care of us.  I love it when the servers become your friends and make sure you have the greatest time. Jessica was awesome.  Also being Christmas time, someone was passing around cheese balls. I want to say it was the owner? (because he looks like the owner).  Yum!  We had a great experience, and Im happy to say I found a new favorite pizza place.  Thank you Pullano's!!

Simply put, my favorite place for pizza, pasta, atmosphere and service in the greater Phoenix area.  My family and I are in 3-4 days a week because we love the food and the staff is the best around.  the Sunday breakfast is awesome...lots of great choice and very inexpensive.  Same with 1/2 off pasta Tuesday.  The pasta is home made and the sauces are delicious!  It's a must if you are in the area!  ~ Rod Cooper

Omggg Pullano's, where do I even start? First of all, this place is crazy close to us, which is a huge bonus :) Ever since "Daddy-O's" (gag me) took over Casey Jones (such a sad day), we've been looking for a new cheap bar that has a good atmosphere.  Enter: Pullano's! My boyfriend's brother told us about it and we finally went a couple of weeks ago... score!! We've been back twice since and, if we didn't keep ordering practically the entire menu and EATING IT ALL, we would go back more often...  The pizza? Awesome! Customize, order straight off the menu, whatever. Certain days they offer crazy specials on pizza (one special offers you a large pizza for free, if I recall correctly), so that's always worth looking into.  Great prices on pitchers of beer-- end of story. Get crunk (or watch your friends get crunk-- DDs are our friends!) on pitchers of beer from $9 (domestic) to $13.25 (seemingly everything else).  The servers are all young and very friendly, which is totally sweet. We've never had a mean or grumpy server-- huge plus. You may even get lucky and have one of the owners serve you, which is so cute, in my opinion.  Thursdays are the days to get wings (although I don't know if this changes...?? Call or check online). When we went (on a Thursday), wings were $.40 and, according to my boyfriend, really good.  I'm personally a fan of the pizza (duh) and the happy hour prices for appetizers-- um, $4 for a GIANT plate of bruschetta? Yeah, sign me up!  The only "downsides", if you can call it that, is that the place is ALWAYS busy. We've gone on a Thursday night, a Saturday around 3 p.m, and a Friday around 8... not "dead" times but not exactly hopping... but Pullano's was BUSY. Be prepared to wait 5 min. more and have to maneuver around large parties (that inexplicably like to push their chairs into the aisle...)  The other thing is the menu--- holy crap. Be prepared to sit there for a solid 10 min. trying to understand it all if its your first time there. The menu is HUGE and the print is really tiny. I mean, I'm practically blind, so take that with a grain of salt, but still. It's tiny print. Just be warned.  That said-- don't go. This is my bar, y'all ;)
Love their food a ton but they don't accept American Express. I had holiday gift cards and those were turned away.
Great local dive bar, good food and drink specials. Don't feel like heading downtown, to scottsdale or somewhere far and just need to relax? This place is perfect.
First time here. Great service. Large menu. Food came out fast and was delicious! We will definitely be back.

It took several days and many phone calls to reach the owner to make this right.  He did eventually refund the money, but it was still more hassle than it was worth.  My rating stands as it is, I will still choose another place for pizza on girls night in.

Today was my first time here,  it's quite a drive from my central phx home,  but it's worth it.  The pizza and wings are delicious, the hot and honey hot wings are delicious and crispy.  This will be our new to go place.  I can't wait to try the happy hour at the bar.  :) I'll be definitely going back.

Garlic Cheesy Bread and wings were on point! service was quick and friendly, you can tell why they have a lot of regulars. Wait staff and bartenders were quick on their feet and worked as a team, something I always appreciate in a restaurant.   Pizza looked good, but I gotta have to get wings when I go!

They have a really awesome lunch special which is a HUGE slice of pizza and 6 wings. Their pizza is eh and so is their wings but the main reason i go to this place as much as i do is because of their BOMB ASS chile limon wing sauce! ITS DELISH!   I've also tried their lasagna which is ok, but they have this plate with 5 giant  cheese ravioli's and thats really great. Its salty but delicious!   for being close to home and a mom and pop, this place isnt not bad. I'll keep coming back!

Hey, wait a second. Since when are pizza parlors this cool? Not only are they a sit down restaurant and delivery spot during the day, they turn into a dive bar at night. Can't say I've seen much of that! And the beers are as cheap as they get. $2 pints of Killian's Red? So awesome that my liver just flinched.  The pizza is just alright. Sweet sauces can be awesome, but only if you have the right crust and cheese to balance that out. On top of that, I know a meaty pizza can get greasy, but Pullano's is excessively so. In hindsight, the $13 for the 16" really wasn't worth it, but maybe if you wait for some of the specials they have on Wednesday, you can sample a cheaper one for yourself. The menu is VERY expansive, too, which tells me you're pretty much gonna get more of the same as far as quality.  3 as a pizza place, but a solid 5 as a dive.

I really like this place a lot. There seems to be a lot of families that go here, larger groups. The waitresses are nice and it's clean inside. I like the HD flat screen tv's. They always seem to have sports on which is what you want at a sports bar. ;) I have not tasted the pizza but i have tried their krab salad, cheese fries, meatball sub, and Italian sub. All of them were fantastic. My boyfriend always gets the philly cheese steak with fries. He says it's decent but still not as good as Philly's Best in Cali. The interior is rather simple and not at all fancy but has a homey appeal to it. Prices are good and you get large portions here. Definitely recommend eating here.
Been going to this place for 25 years, my girls are great (service) and the pizza & wings are the best!!

Pullano's what happened?  Your wings were off the charts, now an order of extra crispy buffalo wings are soggy and just not as good (in the last year). The quality and taste justified the price ($$) for a pizza and wing joint, however, not so much anymore.   When the good wings come back, so will we.

Fun place to eat.  The staff are so willing to meet your needs, including the effort of making a pizza (Taco Pizza) that is no longer on the menu.  An excellent pizza, I might add.  One of the best Taco Pizzas I have had the opportunity to try.  Some of the hot wings my hot wing loving family have had.  Will be going back very soon!!

20 year customer hear........ I'm happy to put 4 stars up on the board. I brought in a sales rep for lunch today he wanted Italian I told him There's only one place to Go PULLANOS! We ate, we talked, we drank, we are some more and were more than happy with the service!!!!!!!

This place doesn't need Yelp's blessings or review because it's been here for a 1,000 years and thanks to the food & drink, will be here for a 1,000 more.  Huge menu with tons of stuff but pizza & wings are the star. Prices are the co-star. We weren't there for happy hour but methinks if you want to get happy (beer) & full (pizza) for not a lot of money, this is the place to do it.  They even have an appetizer that made me like artichokes. (And I HATE artichokes) I think the secret ingredient is magic. Also, perhaps copious amounts of butter.  Family-run operation that definitely appears to be a labor of love --- I put this on my Mt. Rushmore of Italian-style eateries in town (along with Uncle Sam's and Santisi Brothers) -- but you can't beat the bang for your buck.

Ok  been here 3-4 times and finally taking the time to write a short review.  This is a great spot for wings, pizza, salad and subs!!  So far  my top in the Phoenix area  everything I have had.... I have loved.  Im sold it is not to close to my house but Iam convinced I need to drive to get great pizza, lots of flavor and it heats up fantastic the next day (the cheap pizza sometimes is good but doesnt taste like anything the next day!)   the winds are great  and if you like heat  they got it.   the italian sub is great toasted cant wait to go back again for lunch  $7.99 1/2 a sub and salad  great dressing salads are fantastic.  Im sure their pastas are just as good will be there soon to try them out......Customer Service is top notch   servers and very attentive to your needs and freely let you know if a special is a better deal for you.  great place you will love it!!

Food was very good I live down the street but never came in but today I had to go to the laundry mat a few doors down so I decided to go in and check it out. Glad I did I ordered a meatball sandwich and fries it was delicious it was big enough that I took 1/2 home they also sell cheese curds something I can't find at to many places in Az....Bought some to take home..YUMMY!!

This place is delicious....BEST buffalo chicken pizza that I've ever tasted!!! Staff was super friendly and very patient with children.  If they had delivery, my waistline would be in serious danger....well worth the drive, plus delicious desserts after awesome food!
Best pizza and wings in the area. I will go out of my way to order from here! Service is just okay dont expect anything fast, but everyone is in such a rush I guess it tough to be friendly and fast

Great wings with lots of tasty sauce offerings.  "Medium" is always a good choice for bone-in wings.  Decent weeknight deals and happy hour specials so you don't break the bank.  The Italian pasta dinners taste hand-crafted by an Italian grandmother...with abundant portions and fresh side salads.  Ricotta cheese is on point. Bar area service is lacking at times, and separate dining rooms gets pretty crowded.  Overall, a good place to go if you want  to watch sports, drink a few,  fill up your belly, relax, chat, and enjoy.

Wow!!!  The pizza is on point.  Came on Wed and got the special.  A large cheese pizza.  We added two toppings.  It was awesome.  I will be back.  Very cool vibe here!  Everyone was really nice.  And the service was quick!  Thanks!

Yea. Wings are back to original flavor under the name spontaneous combustion. I have been coming to Pullanos since they opened. In 2011 the wings were not as good. Now, Delicious wings and oh so good pizza. Best pizza of my lifetime on 8/8/2016. Extra well done, thin crust, light sauce, cheese pizza. I'm still dreaming about that pizza today!!
Restaurant super clean, location close to ASU West.  Service; Deb on restaurant side is amazing, super friendly and outgoing.  Food; always fresh and yummy.   Check for daily Specials

I have been going here for about 3 years now. I love it. Great food, great happy hour prices. I wish they had a half-pound option for boneless wings because I never finish the full pound. That's my only complaint though. This is my spot for football too, go cardinals!

After having such an awesome time at Super Bowl and enjoying all the amazing food I had to come back here!!! We got this perfectly cooked thin crust pizza with basil So delicious, this will be one of our regular spots from now on! Thanks Pullano's for having a Super Bowl party you got a regular customer here!!!! My husband loved the wings said they were cooked to perfection!  We will be back soon

Our first time here, my nephew and I. We walked in the bar side. Lolz. I was so lost. Haha   Great selection on the menu. The garlic grunch banana bell pepper bread was awesome. :))))  Slow service. I had three people who helped me....rhe check took foreverrrr   Yeah. ..idk if I'll be back. :(

Just left yet another family birthday gathering at Pulano's... everything was perfect... starting with the crab salad and fabulous lemon dressing... always a favorite... the 2 sets of wings were perfect, as were the 2 pizzas... topped off with bday dessert treat!!

Perfect neighborhood, locally owned spot. If you want great pizza (and i know pizza,) delicious wings, and friendly bartenders, you need to get in your car and go to Pullano's! Another get thing on the menu is the artichoke scampi, gotta get it. :)  This not only is a great place for some food that will really stick to your guts, but just a great place to go with friends, have some drinks and get on the juxbox!
Great serviced prices. Employees are friendly and nice. Bathroom is always clean so that's great.  Food tastes good too. Very chill place. I would recommend it.

I have eaten there many times and the food is always really good but I had a bad experience last night. Called in two large thin crust pepperoni pizzas "pretty simple" was craving it all week. I got there early so sat there waiting watching customers come in to pick up orders, 3 out of the 4 were wrong and the customers took it anyway because they didn't want to wait to get it right. Mine came out and it wasn't thin crust but regular crust, they confirmed my call-in ticket and offered to make new ones. Like the others I took it because I didn't want to wait, I was not very satisfied. next time if there's a next time ill ask for my money back and go to Barrows.

My family and I are regulars here at Pullano's, and we love it. The mozzarella sticks are delicious, and the pizza is pretty standard and greasy but still good. This is the perfect place to watch football or any other sporting event, with a few big-screen TV's around the dining room area. The decor is reminiscent of an old-school pizza parlor with the red-checkered table cloths. Overall good food, reasonable prices, and a nice family environment. My only complaint? The service.  SO SLOW.They never refill our   drinks, and half the time three different people are serving you. Good luck knowing who your server is! If the service was more consistent, I would rate this place 5 stars.

I've been going here for years. First, it started in the 1990s with pizza and wings takeout.  Their wings are the best.  I usually get medium.   Wed and Thurs nights are currently my favorite.  Wed is $6 large cheese pizza night, and Thurs is wing night.  The service, at least when I have gone, has always been polite and attentive.  Food is delivered in a reasonable time.  I mainly eat int he restaurant, but have been in the bar.  I also have tried their pasta, and their spaghetti is awesome, as well as their lasagne. Their subs are great too, except the Phili cheese steak  is not quite a Phili...more just a cheese steak with yellow cheese and no mushrooms or peppers, but is still pretty good. The bar has a burger and beer special for $5, and the burger is great.

I think this has to be the best happy hour ever.  $1 bottles and free pizza?  It doesn't get much better than that.  There are also tons of TVs for sports.  When I came there was a Diamondbacks playoff game here and the place was packed.  Service was hit or miss but for the value you are getting who cares.

Ohhhhh ya! This pizza place is legit. The husband has eaten here several times since it's near his work, and he finally brought me a few weeks ago. When you approach, you don't know what to expect.... It looks like a semi divey sports bar from the outside. Inside, you get the feel of a real east coast pizzeria.... You know, red checked plastic tablecloths.... Nothing fancy. We got the pizza and wings combo (which is offered everyday and saves a couple bucks from their separate prices). We got the hot wings, though they have like 20 flavors of sauce. The hot wings were some of the best in town. The chicken was perfectly fried, juicy on the inside and slightly crunchy on the outside and the sauce was your typical hot wing sauce. This would be a must order. The pizza was also awesome.... Definitely not a fancy pizza.... It reminded me of Barro's a bit, because it had a puffier crust than your typical new york pizza, but it tasted better than Barro's. We had pepperoni and ricotta on the pizza, and it was sinfully tasty. This is the place to go in the west valley when you're feeling like a solid 'classic' pizza. Only downside is the price is a little high, but not terrible. Put this place on your to try list!

This pizza's a lot like Barros - greasy, salty and really fills you up. And to be honest, it's not my favorite. But the prices here make it totally worthwhile. I ordered takeout for a large with 1 one topping. Well they had a special for a cheese pizza for 5 bucks on Wednesdays. Total came out to 7 dollars and change for that extra topping (after tax) and I could barely get thru half!  I didn't have time to look at the bar side but the drink prices for happy hour are excellent. 99 cent domestic drafts on weekdays from 3 to 6pm. Also tons of food and drink specials on their website. I'd check this place out because it's so damn cheap, it's hard to knock it.

Pullanos is the only pizza we get when we are craving pizza. Light sauce, whatever toppings I'm feeling, and well done crust is always my order. Their specials and pizza give it four stars, I've had hit and misses with their wings, sometimes they are amazing white meat pieces but I sometimes get a funky over breaded piece or something like cartilage. So can't miss pizza and some friendly service and good appetizers is how I see them.

this place has great pizza. good sandwiches, and good wings. as much as i enjoy the pizza, i gave 4 stars instead of 5, because of one time were the service was not so good. one time. other than that service is pretty solid. beer is always ice cold too.

Pullano's is our go to for the absolutely best pizza! The crust, sauce, flavor and selection of toppings is what keeps us coming back! The salad and bread are super delicious.  The staff is friendly and they recognize us when we arrive each week which makes a difference; it shows they appreciate and value their customers. We eat their delicious food weekly!! Can't wait to return to order our next pizza. If you haven't tried Pullano's it is a must; you won't be disappointed!
Thank you fellow Yelpers, we love this place.  My husband loves the pizza, I am addicted to their wings....mmm....their wings!

A five star review is very rare, this place deserves five stars though. There pizza and wings are amazing and I would recommend this place, and have recommended it to most of my friends. Good date place also!

Ive been coming to this place since I was a kid, and I swear it gets better each visit. We always get the kyles, and wings and they are gone within a matter of moments. The pizza is always hot and fresh and made with the best ingredients.the staff has always been amazing and sweet, and so helpful! Plus my husband and I love watching the game and grabbing a beer. we will always be a customer here!!!!!!!!!!

Wings are great! Gf and I got the medium and garlic parm to split. Both were amazing. Got ranch for the side and it was really good too. Not too thick and not watered down. Drinks were huge and their ice tea is really good. I got lemon and it even looked good. A big slice and it was juicy. (I'm picky) We also got the bacon jalapeño popper and they were super good. Been driving by this place for 5 years and never stopped in to eat...stupid. We'll be back!

1st time at pullano's pizza and was really good , not great but really good. We are from Vegas and we visited some friends , wings to die for but pizza can be little bit more crispy .. but we will come back and trying again...
Love this place... never had anything we didn't like ! The owners Mike and Bonnie are great :)  Nightly specials (my favorite  is Thursday  wing night ) .

This place has great pizza and wings it's one of the best in the valley. Every time I come by here this place is packed.  Great service. The decor is old school pizza style which is rare nowadays but it's definitely worth it to come by and taste this goodness
You can't get any better than the Raspberry Chipotle on 75 cent wing night.  Great beer, great wings, and  great atmosphere equal GREAT NIGHT!  Thank you Mike for your great vibes in Glendale, AZ!

Good old-fashioned American pizza/tavern here, with $2 pints of domestic beers during happy hour when I was there and appetizer specials as well.  I didn't care so much for the "spicy" pasta sauce since it seemed to be marinara with buffalo wing sauce mixed into it.  Pizza was fresh with a pillowy soft crust and good cheese.  Service was prompt, though a bit traditional - I'm glad that there's another pint of beer in front of me without having to order it, but some of us just don't drink the same beer over and over.
Best pizza and wings in town!  They have great specials and service is friendly and pretty fast.

Classic Italian food done right. From their pasta dishes, pizza and subs, you can't go wrong here. I haven't had a meal here that wasn't amazing. Best red sauce! They have great daily food specials, too. Also, the bar area has really good drink specials almost daily. As in $1 bottled beers and free pizza at certain times (if you've ordered a drink, of course). Service is super, the employees here are always friendly and attentive. I really like this place :)

This message is to Mike.  Just wanted to say, I brought my grandma here the other night, and she got mad at me for not showing her this place years ago. She has a real Italian food tooth, and she fell in love with food, and the place. I like how it doesn't look a day out of the late 80's. Just like another, old and memorable submarine sandwhich shop on 35th Ave and Peoria. All these people saying your food is terrible make me laugh. 36 years is hard to come by. Thanks for serving that real food up!
My favorite place for pizza and wings. Best pizza I've found.  Has a little bit of a sweet taste to their sauce. Wings are awesome. Always great service. We highly recommend.
I love this place so much, I went on Wednesday & I'm going back for lunch today.best wings in the city hands down!!!!

Great little restaurant.  We've enjoyed their pasta and their pizzas and have not been disappointed. Everything is fairly priced.   Love their happy hour too!  The staff has always been very friendly. You won't be disappointed if you try this place.

A high three. I hesitated to come here because I do not like eating at a bar but realized I had nothing to fear. Do not let that stop you. They are actually a cute neighborhood restaurant. The bar is separated from the dining area, yeah!  Pros- the NY Pretzel app is quite good. I was very surprised. It even has that slightly burnt NY, city vendor cart taste. I also really liked their Baja dip that comes with the pretzel.   The pizza is not great but not bad either. Kind of AZ average but on the high end. On the positive though their one slice special is huge. Literally two or three meals.   Tiramus is good but again not great. I have had better.  Cons- the service was really not that great. In fact, it was kind of strange. The server was super nice and all and brought the food relatively fast but she never checked on me once. The initial greet also took too long. She never refilled my drinks then just brought me a "to go" refill soda and the check.   Now, I am grateful for the "to go" drink. However, I just found that odd since I did not ask for one nor was I finished eating. I also wanted dessert. Maybe she was just having an off day. I will not hold it against them. All in all it is a very nice neighborhood Italian restaurant. I will go back since their lunch specials look great. However, Rays is not far from me and they really are hard to beat.

I wasn't sure how to rate Pullano's. I'm a little torn. My experience was better than 3 stars but not quite as good as 4.  First, the staff were all very patient and friendly. We were a large party and not sure of what we wanted. We ended up with, a small order of breadsticks, 40 wings (half medium, half BBQ), 1 XL Pepperoni, 1 XL Pepperoni with green peppers.   Breadsticks were brought out soon after our drinks. 2 pitchers of beer, a few sodas. Breadsticks were hot, soft and dripping with butter. Yum! Served with a small cup of marinara that no one touched.  Wings came shortly after. Wings were above average size cooked to mosts liking. (I prefer a super crispy wing, most in our party did not) Sauces on the wings were outstanding. The medium was a really good balance of spice and vinegar tang. BBQ was smoky and sweet. The wings came the old fashioned way with celery and carrots, a nice touch. We had a split of ranch and blue cheese. Ranch was typical, but the blue cheese was strange to me. Don't get me wrong there was nothing wrong with it but t didn't taste like blue cheese. It had a peppery taste and was a creamy color.  Pizza arrived about 5-10 minutes after. The pizza is good but...I hate to say this but it had to much cheese. Yes, too much cheese. I love cheese but the crust on the pizza could not stand up to the weight of all of that cheese. The pizza crust is crispy on the outside, soft in the inside with a slight taste of yeast. The middle of the pizza was a soggy mess after sitting only a few minutes with the cheese barely melted in the middle. I would love that crust with just a smear of sauce and a sprinkling of cheese. Would be heaven on a pizza pan.  Restaurant could use a little scrubbing, but I have to say I enjoyed my first experience at Pullano's and will definitely make another trip.   They also have a small bar attached and there were several TV's in the dining room with football games on. A good place for families.

MMMMMMM.....chicken wings. These are the best wings in town. Pizza is good too. We go for the 30 cent wing ding night on Monday. Split 30 or 40 wings a couple sodas and leave full for less than $15. The happy hour specials in the bar are pretty kick ass too. Can't beat $1 drafts and free pizza. We have turned all of our friends on to Pullano's (including some of the reviewers here).
Great pizza , awesome wings and not to mention happy hour is UNBEATABLE! I've been going here for a year and Deborah our waitress is AMAZING !
